lexUnit.name: inner.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: situated inside; close to the centre.

sentence.text: Most of them are in the outer and inner narthices , on the walls , lunettes and in the ceiling shallow domes and ribbed cupolas .
Glaxo believed it was unnecessary to do this because cells sitting on the inner surface of the gut wall do not divide .

The front door was open , revealing a stone-flagged porch , and an inner door with frosted glass in the top half .
